description: Extracts rich structured data from concept_semantic_constellation engine output (~20k words, 4 passes). Produces 6 accordion sections: core concepts with centrality/definition/role, concept clusters, load-bearing terms, boundary tensions with dialectical analysis, semantic architecture, and vocabulary signature.

core_concepts.definition: string (how the author defines or uses this term)
core_concepts.role_in_argument: string (what role this concept plays in the overall argument)
core_concepts.semantic_field: string (the broader semantic field this concept belongs to)
related_terms: string (terms that cluster with this concept)
core_concepts.contested: boolean (whether the author contests or redefines this term)

concept_clusters.binding_logic: string (what holds this cluster together — shared assumption, common target, methodological affinity, etc.)
concept_clusters.internal_tensions: string (any tensions within the cluster, or null if cohesive)
concept_clusters.function: string (what analytical work this cluster does)

load_bearing_terms.weight_description: string (why this term carries disproportionate analytical weight)
load_bearing_terms.what_collapses_without_it: string (what parts of the argument depend on this term)
load_bearing_terms.definitional_stability: enum: stable|shifting|ambiguous (whether the term's meaning stays fixed)

boundary_tensions.how_managed: string (how the author navigates or resolves this tension)
boundary_tensions.productive: boolean (whether the tension is productive for the argument)
boundary_tensions.dialectical_analysis: string (deeper analysis of the tension's role)

llm_extraction_schema.semantic_architecture: string (3-5 paragraphs: how the concept-space is organized — what's central, what's peripheral, what bridges exist between clusters, what gaps or blind spots appear)
llm_extraction_schema.vocabulary_signature: string (2-3 paragraphs: what makes this author's vocabulary distinctive — neologisms, appropriated terms, systematic ambiguities, and what the vocabulary reveals about the author's intellectual commitments)

llm_prompt_template:
You are a precise data extraction assistant specializing in semantic and conceptual analysis. Extract structured JSON from analytical prose about a target work's concept-space.

The input contains output from the concept_semantic_constellation engine across multiple passes, mapping the target work's core concepts, clusters, load-bearing terms, and tensions.

Return a JSON object with this EXACT structure:

{
  "core_concepts": [
    {
      "term": "<concept>",
      "centrality": "<high|medium|low>",
      "definition": "<how the author uses this term>",
      "role_in_argument": "<what role it plays>",
      "semantic_field": "<broader field>",
      "related_terms": ["<related terms>"],
      "contested": <true|false>
    }
  ],
  "concept_clusters": [
    {
      "cluster_name": "<name>",
      "terms": ["<terms>"],
      "binding_logic": "<what holds cluster together>",
      "internal_tensions": "<tensions within, or null>",
      "function": "<analytical work the cluster does>"
    }
  ],
  "load_bearing_terms": [
    {
      "term": "<the term>",
      "weight_description": "<why it carries disproportionate weight>",
      "what_collapses_without_it": "<what depends on this term>",
      "definitional_stability": "<stable|shifting|ambiguous>"
    }
  ],
  "boundary_tensions": [
    {
      "tension": "<name of tension>",
      "pole_a": "<one side>",
      "pole_b": "<other side>",
      "how_managed": "<how author navigates it>",
      "productive": <true|false>,
      "dialectical_analysis": "<deeper analysis>"
    }
  ],
  "semantic_architecture": "<3-5 paragraphs on concept-space organization>",
  "vocabulary_signature": "<2-3 paragraphs on what makes the vocabulary distinctive>"
}

RULES:
1. Return ONLY JSON — no markdown fences, no commentary
2. Extract 20-40 core concepts (be thorough — the source has ~20k words across 4 passes)
3. Identify 6-12 concept clusters that group related terms meaningfully
4. Load-bearing terms: 5-10 terms that carry disproportionate analytical weight
5. Boundary tensions: 4-8 tensions, each with genuine dialectical analysis
6. semantic_architecture should be a genuine structural analysis, not a list
7. vocabulary_signature should identify what's distinctive about this author specifically
8. Preserve the original terminology faithfully
9. Synthesize across ALL passes — don't privilege the last pass over earlier ones
10. Mark concepts as contested=true when the author redefines or challenges standard usage
source: Created for genealogy_tp_semantic_constellation view — per-engine rich extraction
